title: What are the main philosophies of ethics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Deontology, utilitarianism, rights, and virtues. I’d recommend checking out this PDF on the subject: https://www.dsef.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/EthicalTheories.pdf Deontology is not concerned with the consequences of actions, but whether those actions are in themselves right or wrong. Utilitarianism is the doctrine that we ought to achieve the maximum quality of happiness/pleasure for the maximum quantity of agents. Every action then should be with this in mind. Rights - Think of the basic rights we believe everyone has as people. Virtue ethics is concerned with someone's character, not by actions that deviate from someone's norms.
The primary importance in ethics is that justice always be done. Determining exactly what is justice depends frequently on the society in question,
